column5: Amazing fish!
What a tank...  Looks like a clear musky too... And clean...  Congrats...
Awesome fish, fluke or not.  Congrats!!
And the moral of the story is...keep your lure in the water cause you never know!!!  Awesome fish...congrats!
WOW  spelled backwards WOW~!!!!!
WOW! Big congrats
Wow ! Congrats , fish of a lifetime for sure ! .. what a tank

As for weight ( please nobody throw rocks at me ) I would hazard a guess and think it's safe to assume 43-46 lbs ,maybe more , without the girth nobody knows ... really .. it doesn't matter ! It's without a doubt a nuclear sub !
Well congratulations, that certainly is a fish of a lifetime.  What a beauty!!!
X 2
Awesome!!...congrats
I was thinking the very same  thing.    Never seen a fish that size there.   Still in awe just looking at the pics.   Pants filler for sure.
Wow! Great fish, congrats!
CONGRATS !!! Quite a catch for your first ski.  When you least expect it .................POW !
yup, that's something else!
Congrats on the fish!!! Holy geebus that's a monster. Oh and congrats on still having your hand after removing the hook haha.
Absolute Beauty man.  Congrats !!! You've set the bar pretty high for yourself.
What a brute!  I think we need to cast that as the star of Muskynado!   (Feel free to steal that name for one of your musky baits.  You're welcome, lol.)  Cheers to the guys who helped you out too.
Beautiful Ski!  I hope to get one that size on the French,...., one day.....   WR
You lucky man! That's a great fish! Congrats
fish of a lifetime for sure, what a beast, one word of advice regarding muskie fishing........ quit while your ahead.  nice to see her go back  congrats!!
Just an amazing fish. Thank you for handling her with such care. I'm jealous.
I can see now - monthly MA meetings  (Muskies Anonymous)
Thanks for all the support!!!
Outstanding fish, congratulations!
Right on man!  Great catch!  It looks like you handled her very well for your first time with a Ski on the line, specially one of that size!  Good job man!
what a monster!!!  Great fish.  Its going to be really hard to top that beauty   Nick

Heard about this fish yesterday from my friend Kevin who was staying in the next cabin over to you. Awesome fish, congrats!!! Most die hard Musky fisherman won't see a fish like that in their lifetime.
Fantastic!  The smile on your face says it all.
I'm insanely jealous...  Hate hate hate...  Grow some dang byceps LOL

Hi all...just back from the French River, Wolseley Bay.  Fishing was great.  Only 1 walleye all week despite lots of trying, but the bass and pike were definitely on.  Nothing massive, but lots of them.  On my second night there, I got this beauty.  Disclaimer: I am not a musky fisherman...in fact this is the first I have gotten.  I don't target them...and yes this was a total fluke catch!  I tried my best to handle her properly and she swam away beautifully.  I was trolling a weed bed with a #3 Mepps Aglia (thanks Big Cliff for the tip    ).  She hit like a freight train.  After about 10 minutes I got her to the boat.  I had drifted to shore and got out in a couple feet of water to handle her.  A couple quick pics and a tape measure and back she went. She measured 56"   .....any guesses on weight?
Simply awesome  !!!   Congrats
That is a fish of a life time! Congrats!

Thanks.  I had it in my original post...but must have deleted it....but I have to give a shout out too.  There I was with this monster on my line....not knowing what to do...no camera, etc.  I flagged down a passing boat.  It was a couple of young guys who admitted that they were scared I was OPP busting them for not wearing their life jackets.  They took the photos of the fish for me.  I gave them my email and they promised to send the pics.  I was so frazzled, I didn't even get their names.  They could of done nothing, but they followed through and helped me remember this moment.  If they happen to read this...thank you!
If your gonna start musky fish'n, you may as well start with a 56" brute like that, congrats on getting her, she's a true trophy !!
Wow!! Nice one for sure!!!!  S.
Awesome fish man !!!! That is a fish of a lifetime !!!! The addiction is officially on now you are hooked for life !!!!!!!
Totally killer congrats for getting that awesome musky. Like Lew said that's a good way to start into musky fishing.
Massive fish with a massive head. Nice!

Well, I did say don't worry about the size of the bait (among other things) LOL. Now I feel bad because you are probably going to have to fish a life time to match that catch. Congratulations!  Now, without spilling the beans, did you catch it and most of the pike doing what I suggested?
Wow, that thing is a giant!   That's easily a 40lb class fish.
Big Cliff...I did exactly what you said...so yes
That is one awesome fish! Congrats.  I might even recognize that beach behind you.  Friggin awesome!!
Look at the massive head on that beast! Too bad you didn't get a good shot of her.. but you're hooked now buddy !!! lol
Man what an unbelievable fish! I would be shaking in my boots holding that monster, congratulations!
I concur with everyone else saying that is indeed a fish of a lifetime.
A incredible musky, and absolutely gorgeous, you have set the bar very high for yourself to beat, congradulations

What a catch! my co worker is up there right now, he was telling me he was going to shoot for musky I laughed and told him he better pick up a new rod and reel because he has 8lb test and an ugly stik and that's it haha. seeing all these wolsley bay reports ill have to make it up there best year for a trip looks like a great place.  nice job!
wow great fish and awesome story. Fish of a lifetime for sure. I guess you know where all the walleye went.
Wow that's a brute dude.congrats. being a fluke were you fishing with mono line? If so that would make it even  cool the line not snapping.
Fantastic!!
That is a cow!!  Congratulations.

Wow, great Muskie! 40 lb. neighborhood.  Great job with the release, without a pardner and proper Muskie release gear you did the best thing you could, you went into shallow water and got in with her...
Look at your hand and compare it to the head.   The head is huge.  Congrats.
congrats, what a giant !
